author: Staff Reporter
text:
In a move to help resettled residents travel to their workplaces without any difficulty, the Tamil Nadu Slum Clearance Board (TNSCB) has submitted a proposal to the State government to issue free bus passes to them.

“Many residents had approached us asking for bus passes, so we prepared this plan,” said a senior official from TNSCB.

Over 4,000 flood affected people have been resettled in the last three months in Okkiyam Thoraipakkam and Perumbakkam.

But ever since the allotment, residents have been complaining about the loss of their livelihood.

“Travelling to the city has become very difficult for us. We have lost our jobs and we are trying to manage with whatever we have,” said S. Kavitha, of Ezhil Nagar in Perumbakkam.

“If our transport arrangement is sorted out, it will be a great relief and rest of the things will be fine,” she added. The free bus pass, if issued, will be valid for one whole year.

The MTC had introduced buses on 10 new routes that connect TNSCB tenements at Thoraipakkam and Perumbakkam with Saidapet, Guindy, Tambaram and rest of the city, officials said.
title: Resettled residents may soon get free bus passes
